benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/paymentMethods/refresh - Refresh account payment methods

covered: PUT Valid Request: TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04 cover valid refresh scenarios with required and optional parameters; TC05 covers all optional headers; TC06 covers operation with no payment methods; TC07, TC08, TC09, TC10 include various validation/error paths; TC11, TC12, TC16, TC17 cover input validation and error handling for pluginName and pluginProperty; TC13, TC14, TC20, TC21, TC23, TC24, TC25, TC29 cover integration/gateway, performance, and privacy/security edge cases; TC26 covers data consistency; TC27, TC28 cover state variations; TC30 addresses accessibility; TC08, TC09, TC18, TC19 address invalid IDs and edge cases; TC23 addresses concurrency; TC25 addresses integration/plugin service failures; TC22 covers backward compatibility; TC24 tests large payload concerns.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination handling for large datasets.
Caching Behavior: No scenarios testing caching behavior (ETag, Cache-Control) present.
Rate Limiting: No explicit tests for rate limiting or throttling.
Authorization nuance beyond missing header: No explicit tests for 403 vs 401 differentiation or role-based access control beyond generic unauthorized.
Extensive negative edge cases around extremely large pluginProperty payloads or repeated rapid retries not exhaustively covered.
recommendations: Add pagination-related tests if the backend could expose paginated results in related endpoints or for bulk data scenarios.
Add tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) and cache invalidation behavior when refreshing payment methods.
Add explicit rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure the endpoint gracefully handles burst requests or repeated calls.
Expand authorization tests to differentiate between 400/401/403 in more granular contexts and verify role-based access control.
Enhance negative edge-case coverage for very large pluginProperty payloads, repeated rapid requests, and retry logic.
